====Compounds====
{{der-top|Compounds}}
* {{ja-r|お姫|おひめ}}: [[princess]]
* {{ja-r|姫様|ひめ-さま}}: [[honorable]] princess {{qualifier|term of address or reference}}

===Etymology===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ひめ}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=ひめ}}. Originally {{IPAchar|/pi<sub>1</sub>me<sub>1</sub>/}}. {{IPAchar|*[pime]}} → {{IPAchar|[ɸime]}} → {{IPAchar|[hime]}}. Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=ひめ|日|tr1=hi|t1=sun|女|tr2=me|t2=woman}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> The male equivalent is {{m|ja|彦|tr=hiko}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ひめ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|ひめ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=ひめ|euphemistic}} a woman
# a [[noblewoman]], a [[lady]], a [[princess]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=ひめ|slang}} in the Kyōto and Ōsaka areas, a [[prostitute]]
# short for {{m|ja|姫糊|tr=himenori}}, a kind of [[starch]] [[glue]] made from boiled-down rice

===Prefix===
{{ja-pos|prefix|ひめ}}

# prefix expressing [[cuteness]] or [[smallness]]

====Derived terms====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|月の姫|つき-の-ひめ}}: the [[princess]] of the [[moon]]: ''Kaguya-hime'' from ''[[w:The Tale of the Bamboo Cutter|The Tale of the Bamboo Cutter]]''
* {{ja-r|木花之開耶姫|^こ-の-はな-の-さく-ひめ}}: (Shintō): in Japanese mythology, the blossom princess and symbol of delicate earthly life
{{der-bottom}}
